Key Arguments: The proposed legislation will damage free speech, which is a non-negotiable human right.
The definition of 'misinformation' in the bill is too subjective, particularly regarding what constitutes 'harm'.
Governments cannot effectively police subjective perceptions of harm.
There is a trend of increasing restrictions on speech in Australia, and this bill represents an extreme version of that trend.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is a non-negotiable human right and must be safeguarded.
It is simply not possible for governments to police such subjectivity.
